target_markets.market_description: Business owners and entrepreneurs looking to scale their companies
pain_points: not enough customers knowing they exist
target_markets.market_size_indicators: mentions 10% of customers are 'whales' who want to buy the most expensive option

problems_validated.problem: Business owners underpricing their products and services
problems_validated.severity: high - can cost $900 in lost revenue per customer
problems_validated.current_solutions: setting single price points without anchoring
problems_validated.market_gap: lack of understanding of psychological pricing and anchoring tactics

problems_validated.problem: Businesses not advertising enough due to fear of harassment
problems_validated.severity: critical - biggest threat to business survival
problems_validated.market_gap: misunderstanding of how much repetition is needed for brand awareness

business_strategies.strategy: Anchoring tactic - add extremely expensive option you never plan to sell
business_strategies.implementation: Put something 10-100x more expensive on your menu/service list
business_strategies.expected_results: Increases sales of core offer and allows price increases
business_strategies.case_study: Weight loss business friend added 6x higher price version, people bought it more than core offer, tripled profit overnight

business_strategies.strategy: 4x4 rule - four hours daily on core four activities
business_strategies.implementation: Reach out to people you know, reach out to strangers, make content, run ads
business_strategies.expected_results: Increased brand awareness and customer acquisition
business_strategies.case_study: Speaker gets stopped 4-5 times during 60-minute walks due to consistent visibility

business_strategies.implementation: Prioritize customer acquisition over product refinement in early stages
business_strategies.expected_results: Enough iterations and feedback to improve product
business_strategies.case_study: Speaker's experience selling 9 companies over 13 years

problems_solutions.solution: Use anchoring with extremely expensive option
steps: Add option 10-100x more expensive than core offer
Position it as something you'd be happy to sell but don't expect to
Watch it make your main offer look affordable

problems_solutions.problem: Not enough people know your business exists

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Making $100 offer to someone with $1000 budget
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Lose $900 of potential revenue per customer
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Always have premium pricing options available
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Only offering low-priced options when 10% of customers want to buy the most expensive thing

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Stopping advertising too early due to personal fatigue
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Customers never become aware of your brand or offerings
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Remember audience needs reminders more than teaching
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Henry Ford CMO story - founder was tired of seeing campaign that hadn't even started running yet

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Focusing on product perfection before customer acquisition
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Not enough feedback iterations to improve product
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Need enough people coming in to get feedback on whether product is good

growth_tactics.tactic: Rule of 100 - create 100 minutes of content daily
steps: Commit to 100 minutes daily content creation
growth_tactics.results_expected: increased brand awareness and customer recognition

metrics_kpis.optimization_tip: Focus 100% on advertising until this milestone is reached

metrics_kpis.benchmark: 100 minutes content OR 100 outreaches OR $100 ad spend
metrics_kpis.optimization_tip: Maintain consistency in at least one of the three channels

trends_signals.trend: Customer willingness to pay premium prices
trends_signals.opportunity: 10% of customers actively seek most expensive options - 'whale' customers represent significant revenue opportunity

actionable_quotes.quote: The only thing worse than making a $1,000 offer to somebody with a $100 budget is making a $100 offer to someone with a $1,000 budget
actionable_quotes.context: Discussing the importance of having premium pricing options
actionable_quotes.actionability: Always include high-priced options to capture high-budget customers

actionable_quotes.quote: We need to be reminded more than we need to be taught
actionable_quotes.context: Explaining why repetitive advertising and content works
actionable_quotes.actionability: Don't fear repeating your core messages - audiences want consistent reminders

actionable_quotes.quote: Until you're at $100,000 a month advertising is all of your focus
actionable_quotes.context: Prioritizing customer acquisition over product development in early stages
actionable_quotes.actionability: Dedicate resources to marketing and advertising before perfecting product

key_statistics.statistic: Speaker sold last company for $46.2 million
Current portfolio generates $17 million per month
10% of customers want to buy the most expensive option
Friend tripled profit overnight with premium pricing
